==Japanese==

{{wikipedia|lang=ja|アザラシ}}
{{wikipedia|Earless seal}}
[[File:Seehund.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|海豹}} (''azarashi''): a '''{{l|en|true seal}}''', an '''{{l|en|earless seal}}'''.]]
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|sort=あざらし}}

===Etymology 1===
Originally a compound of {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=あざらし}} elements {{com|ja|sort=あざらし|痣|tr1=aza|t1={{l|en|bruise}}|等|tr2=ra</i>|pos2=a pluralizer|t2={{l|en|lots of}}|獣|tr3=shi|t3={{l|en|beast}}|pos3=especially one used for meat}}. The ''bruise'' meaning was in reference to the spotted coat.

The kanji are {{juku|sort=あざらし}}, from {{der|ja|zh|海豹|lit={{l|en|sea}} {{l|en|leopard}}|sort=あざらし}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|あざらし|acc=2|acc_ref=NHK,DJR,SMK5}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|あざらし|アザラシ}}

# a {{l|en|seal}}, specifically the {{l|en|earless seal}} or {{l|en|true seal}}

=====Usage notes=====
{{U:ja:biology|アザラシ}}

Note the distinction between {{m|ja|海豹|tr=azarashi}} for {{m|en|seal}}, which has no external ear flaps, and {{m|ja|海驢|tr=ashika}} for {{m|en|sea lion}}, which does have external ear flaps.

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|海豹%肢%症|あざらし%し%しょう}}: “seal-limb disease” → {{l|en|phocomelia}}
{{der-mid}}
* {{ja-r|豹 海豹|ヒョウ アザラシ}}: a {{l|en|leopard seal}}
* {{ja-r|象 海豹|ゾウ アザラシ}}: an {{l|en|elephant seal}}
{{der-bottom}}

=====See also=====
{{der-top|See also}}
* {{ja-r|海驢|あしか}}: a {{l|en|sea lion}}
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|かい|ひょう}}

From {{der|ja|ltc|sort=かいひょう|海豹|tr={{IPAchar|/hʌi<sup>X</sup> pˠau<sup>H</sup>/}}|lit=sea + leopard}}.
